intro: Mischocarpus endotrichus, commonly known as the golden spondias, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into orange to red fruits, which are edible and have a sweet, acidic flavor. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
